name: Beetroot, Swede and Potato Bake
author: Daylesford
ingredients:
- 450ml double cream
- 450ml milk
- 2 cloves garlic, sliced
- 1 large sprig of fresh thyme, leaves only
- salt and pepper
- 2 large baking potatoes, peeled
- 3 large beetroot, peeled
- 2 medium swede, peeled
instructions:
- Preheat the oven to 170C
- Put the cream, milk, garlic and thyme into a medium pan and bring to a simmer, then immediately remove from the heat, season and leave to stand and infuse while you prepare the vegetables.
- With a mandoline or sharp knife, slice the vegetables very finely and keep them separate.
- Start to layer up the vegetables in a deep baking dish, starting with potato.
- Season, then spread with 3 tbsp of the milk and cream mixture. Next, add a layer of beetroot followed by 3 tbsp of the sauce and season, and then repeat with a layer of swede.
- Continue until all the vegetables are used up, reserving enough potato to finish with as the last layer. Season again, pour any remaining liquid over the top.

- Push the  vegetables down gently with your fingers to ensure all the layers are immersed, cover with a sheet of greaseproof paper and then some foil.
- Prick a few holes with a knife or skewer to allow steam to escape during cooking.
- Place the baking dish on a baing tray (to catch any overflow) and put into the pre-heated oven for 1 hour.
- Remove the foil and continue to bake for 10 more minutes, until golden brown on top.

- Remove from the oven and leave to settle for 5 minutes before serving.
